transcript:
of all, by the millions of generations from our forefather Adam to our own times, is that temple reared which is to be a worthy dwelling place of the Great God," he added, and closed his eyes. 
"I ought to tell you that I do not believe ... do not believe in God," said Pierre, regret- fully and with an effort, feeling it essential to speak the whole truth. 
The Mason looked intently at Pierre and smiled as a rich man with millions in hand might smile at a poor fellow who told him that he
